UTEID: jm76685;
FIRSTNAME: Jonathan;
LASTNAME: Madden;
CSACCOUNT: jm76685;
EMAIL: jm76685@cs.utexas.edu;

[Program 4 Extra Credit]
[Description]
There are 2 java files: In Encoder.java, The most important methods are decodeFile and encodeFile. The method decodeFile
uses the mappings of encryptions to characters to interpret the file one line at a time. The method encodeFile uses the 
mappings of characters to encyptions to write out a file of encodings. All of the other methods are for creating the huffman
codes used for the mappings or for generating a random string of text.
In Node.java, this is the data structure used for the huffman tree. This is taken from  
http://cs.smith.edu/dftwiki/index.php/CSC212_Huffman_Ecoding_in_Java.
To compile our program, you need to use "javac Encoder.java". To run our program, you need to use 
java Encoder frequenciesFile k j, where frequenciesFile is the name of a file containing integers representing the relative 
frequencies of characters in the alphabet (as described in the first step above), and k is a positive integer that tells 
how many characters to generate (according to that probability distribution) and j is the number of symbols to use in the encoding.
To test the entropy of a file, use a fifth command line argument of the fileName, ex java Encoder frequenciesFile k j PrideAndPrejudice

[Finish]
I finished all of the project extra credit.  The entropy calculated from the file Pride and prejudice was 
Entropy: 4.1812742263162015 and my encoding was 4.23 for two symbols.  This is close to the entropy that  is found on the slides of 
4.219 for the general entropy,  but still a ways off from what Estimates by Shannon 
based on human experiments which have yielded values as low as 0.6 to 1.3 bits per symbol. If we are just considering them
independently, then this model is good, but there are greater levels of using dependencies on each other, which in my opinion makes
this still a bad encoding of english. 

[Test Case 1]
[Command line]
java Encoder frequenciesFile 4 3

[Input]
4
3
2
1

[Output]
Entropy: 1.8464393446710154

1 symbol Encodings
A 0
B 10
C 111
D 110

Efficiency1: 1.0030115559143782  bitAvg: 1.852

[Test Case 2]
[Command line]
java Encoder frequenciesFile 4 2 PrideAndPrejudice

[Input]
(Pride and Prejudice)

[Output]

Frequency of A is :41704
Frequency of B is :9091
Frequency of C is :13469
